author: Noemie Bisserbe
title: Novartis CEO Steers Drug Maker Back to R&D
text:
Novartis AG has spent the past five years getting smaller. Its new chief executive has to decide soon how much more it will shrink.

Vasant Narasimhan, a 41-year-old Harvard-trained doctor, took the helm earlier this month at Novartis, the world’s No. 2 prescription-drug firm by sales after Pfizer Inc. Dr. Narasimhan has promised a technological revolution at Novartis to boost its drug-development pipeline.
